definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: You can tell he is a parvenu.
sentences.chinese: 你看他财大气粗，就知道他是个暴发户。

sentences.english: A lot of these newly rich people are just big bootleggers, you know.
sentences.chinese: 有很多这样的暴发户都是大私酒贩子，你要知道。

sentences.english: A parvenu swaggers by oneself at a party.
sentences.chinese: 有个暴发户在舞会上神气活现地四处走动。

sentences.english: The bounder's ostentatious life showed his inanition .
sentences.chinese: 暴发户摆阔的生活方式显示出他的浅薄。

sentences.english: In the future there is a chance that the nouveau riche could take advantage of capitalist-style democracy, " warns Mr."
sentences.chinese: 未来，那些暴发户有可能会利用资本主义式民主。

sentences.english: Boasting about size may be poor form and the sign of an arriviste.
sentences.chinese: 吹嘘规模或许并非得体的行为，也是暴发户的象征。

sentences.english: The employer is a bad parvenu only.
sentences.chinese: 这个雇主只是个恶劣地土暴发户而已。

sentences.english: The drawing-rooms of predatory new-rich women.
sentences.chinese: 掠夺成性的女暴发户们的客厅。

sentences.english: Tanzania’s government is not accustomed to upstart s.
sentences.chinese: 坦桑尼亚政府还不习惯成为暴发户。

sentences.english: She is one of the nouveau riche in her hometown.
sentences.chinese: 她是当地的暴发户之一。

sentences.english: An unexpected inheritance catapulted him into the ranks of the nouveaux riches.
sentences.chinese: 继承了一笔意外的财产使他晋身为暴发户之列。

sentences.english: But many girls nowaday do want to marry a man filthy with dough.
sentences.chinese: 但是现在很多女孩子都想嫁给暴发户。
坏人通常是喜欢炫耀的暴发户。

sentences.english: McPherson's general attitude suggested that he regarded me as an upstart.
sentences.chinese: 麦克弗森总的态度表明，他认为我是一个暴发户。

definition: country bumpkin/boor/unsophisticated country person (humble, applied to oneself)/burial mound
to parade one's wealth/to be ostentatious and extravagant
ground beetle/(coll.) professional or entrepreneur who, unlike a 海歸|海归[hai3 gui1], has never studied overseas/(dialect) country bumpkin
children of entrepreneurs who became wealthy under Deng Xiaoping's economic reforms in the 1980s/see also 窮二代|穷二代[qiong2 er4 dai4]
richly bedecked/dripping with gold and silver (idiom)
poor wretch/pauper/destitute man/poverty-stricken peasant/penniless good-for-nothing/impecunious vagabond
(Wu dialect) bum/wretched-looking tramp who lives by begging or stealing
